articles.title: The US Supreme Court has made another major abortion decision. How will it affect the election?
articles.description: For the first time since his supporters stormed the Capitol on January 6, Donald Trump returned to meet Republican politicians. The Supreme Court had just given them something to talk about.
articles.content:

articles.title: Attorney charged in voting machine tampering case announces run for Michigan Supreme Court
articles.description: Republican attorney Matthew DePerno, a supporter of former President Donald Trump, to run for Michigan Supreme Court
articles.content:
An attorney charged in connection with an effort to illegally access and tamper with voting machines in Michigan after the 2020 election said Thursday that he’s running for the state’s high court.

articles.author: New York Daily News
articles.title: U.S. Supreme Court rejects 'Trump Too Small' trademark
articles.description: The U.S. Supreme Court nixed a California man’s bid to trademark the slogan “Trump Too Small" for T-shirts. But the shirts are still available for purchase.
articles.content:
The U.S. Supreme Court on Thursday nixed a California man’s bid to trademark the slogan “Trump Too Small.”
Attorney and activist Steve Elster had sought sole domain over the phrase for use on T-shirts and other merchandise, an allusion to former pres... [1363 chars]

articles.title: Texas Man Threatens FBI Over Hunter Biden Case
articles.description: Timothy Muller of Fort Worth, Texas, was charged with threatening an FBI agent investigating Hunter Biden's criminal case. Accused of making across-state threats and retaliating against a federal official, Mueller left a violent voicemail suggesting repercussions if President Donald Trump wasn't re-elected.
articles.content: A Texas was charged on Thursday with threatening to jail or "slaughter" an FBI agent over the criminal case against President Joe Biden's son, Hunter Biden, federal prosecutors said. Timothy Muller, 43, was charged in a criminal complaint with making... [1322 chars]

articles.title: Trump and Biden Vie for Corporate Favor Ahead of Elections
articles.description: U.S. Republican presidential candidate Donald Trump and Jeff Zients, President Joe Biden's White House chief of staff, met with top American business leaders in Washington to gain support from corporate America. Both candidates are focusing on economic strategies and regulation policies to appeal to powerful CEOs ahead of the upcoming election.

articles.title: Trump Advocates Tariffs Over Tax, Slams U.S. Aid to Ukraine in Capitol Hill Visit
articles.description: During a Capitol Hill visit, Donald Trump criticized U.S. aid to Ukraine and proposed replacing income tax with tariffs. He aimed to mend Republican divisions ahead of the November elections, while also discussing policies on tariffs, tips, and abortion. His visit drew mixed reactions from party members and Democrats.
articles.content:

articles.title: Why CEOs fear Trump

articles.title: Yellen Rebukes China's Economic Approach and Trump's Supply-Side Economics
articles.description: U.S. Treasury Secretary Janet Yellen criticized China's state subsidies and traditional supply-side economics, advocating for public-private investments to spur sustainable growth. In a speech to top business leaders, she contrasted Biden's economic strategy with Trump's tax cuts and deregulations. Yellen emphasized the importance of infrastructure, education, and public interventions.
